definitions.text: an adult person who is male (as opposed to a woman)
examples: there were two women and six men on the bus

definitions.text: someone who serves in the armed forces; a member of a military force
the generic use of the word to refer to any human being
examples: it was every man for himself

definitions.text: any living or extinct member of the family Hominidae characterized by superior intelligence, articulate speech, and erect carriage

examples: the chief stationed two men outside the building
he awaited word from his man in Havana

definitions.text: an adult male person who has a manly character (virile and courageous competent)
examples: the army will make a man of you

definitions.text: a manservant who acts as a personal attendant to his employer
a male person who plays a significant role (husband or lover or boyfriend) in the life of a particular woman
examples: she takes good care of her man

definitions.text: one of the British Isles in the Irish Sea
game equipment consisting of an object used in playing certain board games
examples: he taught me to set up the men on the chess board
he sacrificed a piece to get a strategic advantage

definitions.text: all of the living human inhabitants of the earth
examples: all the world loves a lover
she always used `humankind' because `mankind' seemed to slight the women

definitions.text: take charge of a certain job; occupy a certain work place
examples: Mr. Smith manned the reception desk in the morning
We cannot man all the desks
